attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I have a lesson for every situation I learned from observing nature

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current:
Life is like the seasons, in constant change,
and we must change with it.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I suffer awful visions of a upcoming disaster and will do anything to prevent it

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.

attribs.name: racial_traits
attribs.current:
Flight. You have a flying speed of 50 feet. To use this speed, you can’t be wearing medium or heavy armor.

Talons. 
You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal 1d4 slashing damage on a hit.

attribs.name: background
attribs.current:
FEATURE: Wanderer:
You have an excellent memory for maps and geography and can alway recall general layouts and terrain, settlements, and other features around you. You can also find food, fresh water for yourself and up to 5 people.

attribs.name: class_features
attribs.current:
Unarmored Defense
While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

Wind Missile
When you choose this feature you gain the ability to fire ammunition without the use of weapons. When you take the attack action you can use your control of air power to launch any kind of ammunition as an attack. All ammunition fired in this way has a range of 100 feet and deals 1d8 of damage. The type of damage is dependent upon the ammunition fired (arrows=piercing, sling bullets=bludgeoning, etc.) All ammunition you use is considered to be fired from a weapon with which you are proficient allowing you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. Rate of fire is 2 per attack action. You must still make a ranged attack roll and may add all modifiers as with a normal attack. The damage dealt by this ability increases at levels 5 (1d10), 10 (1d12), and 15 (2d10). The range also increases by 20 feet at 10th level.

attribs.name: inventoryname3
attribs.current: a trophy from an animal you killed,

attribs.name: class_abilities_and_feats
attribs.current:
Backstory:

Its not known how many there are, but "Raptor" to his acquaintances showed up  it the sky above the Ironcrest Mountains.  A little more than a year ago, thought to be an abomination ... the creature  was shooed away by arrows for weeks before it started to pick up the arrows in what appeared to be a satchel, and then later a Quiver worn bandolier style.

Hundreds of  feet over the caravan on its way towards Vixen, the creature seems to hove and cried out - in broken english something akin to 

"Aragan dits! Braaa Ang dits!!"  

Seeing no comprehension and the ongoing upward barrage of arrows, the creature dove into the inverted rain deftly picking up arrows as they reached their apex. then in an elegant wingover - dove into the wash near the road ahead, a series of curses and much more audible screams - pain replaced frustration and the creature launched wave upon wave into the wash which, like a disturbed anthill began to overflow with highway men that sought the relative safety of the trade caravan....

Some made it, most did not.

 The bird thing pecked away at the few arrows that had either pierced him or were just caught amongst the mammoth feathers. 

One eye always seeing the approaching guards men, the creature preened his feathers making sure no arrow heads or shafts remain.

After the creature was deemed to be "safe" the caravan approached it to talk and perhaps capture it.  But after a good meal (in which Ara'akkaata quickly cooked a meal of remarkable quality....

It became somewhat clear, that Ara'akkaata had only recently become consciously aware of his own existence.  

While he dimly recalls being 'connected' to a source of magic, he is also aware that that person wasn't around when he became fully consciously aware of his intellect. It may be that the mage enchanted him, or perhaps he was a familiar who was affected by the radiation.   He's not sure.  And although the thought intrigues him intellectually, its not a driving factor for his life.  

He's thankful to ride the winds and talk with the air. He's joyous in the hunt and in companionship, that (only somewhat consciously acknowledges - he doesn't feel abandon him )

His first human he found was Gogen,  a Druid, with whom he spend the last year and a half learning the common tongue (poorly)  he is difficult to understand because of his lack of lips so his tongue clicks and often for hard C and his O's are often soft a's.  Gogen's animal affinity and ability to speak primordial as well facilitate their exchanges and Raptor quickly learned (as he does) the language 'common' though somewhat haltingly, and discordantly...

Soon, sounds more like SKaaaan.  That and his odd, sudden head tilts and penetrating gaze, that seems to quickly move from jovial to predatorial - is off putting for most. (Hence his Low Charisma)

But, he learned much about the useless excesses of Human civilization. THough he remains very attached to humans in general and to children especially (though Dwarves, Gnomes and Halflings often fall into that category).

He is approach 3 years old, and his naivety remains sharp and pointedly reminding those around him of his lack of social decorum or pleasantries.

attribs.name: repeating_spellbookcantrip_2_spelldescription
attribs.current: (a bit of fleece) You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends. If you create an image of an objectsuch as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chestit must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

attribs.name: repeating_spellbookcantrip_0_spelldescription
attribs.current: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn. The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spellbookcantrip_1_spelldescription
attribs.current: A spectral, floatin hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again. You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked foor or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it. The hand can’t attack, activate magical items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

attribs.name: repeating_weapons_melee_1_emote
attribs.current: Talons arcs blueish electricity (shocking Hands w/ talon attack) drive at ...

attribs.name: repeating_spellbookcantrip_2_spellemote
attribs.current: plucks one of his feathers and and suddenly.... the falling stops, and the glide begins

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_0_spelldescription
attribs.current: Reaction: When you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature’s rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_0_spellemote
attribs.current: plucks a small feather and the falling stops and a lazy wafting replaces it

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_0_spellcomponents
attribs.current: (a small feather or piece of down

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_1_spelldescription
attribs.current: Reaction trigger: You are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_2_spelldescription
attribs.current: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t pushed. In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell’s effect, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_2_spellhighersloteffect
attribs.current: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spellbooklevel1_2_spellemote
attribs.current: beak opens and this wings clap together
